abstract: Four employees of global mining giant Rio Tinto in Shanghai have been detained by Chinese authorities, the firm said Tuesday.
snippet: Four employees of global mining giant Rio Tinto in Shanghai have been detained by Chinese authorities, the firm said Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Four employees of global mining giant Rio Tinto in Shanghai have been detained by Chinese authorities, the firm said Tuesday.

headline.main: Rio Tinto Says China Detains 4 Staffers

abstract: The Australian packaging group Amcor is nearing a purchase of some of Rio Tinto’s assets, in a deal that could be valued at up to $2.4 billion, Reuters reported.
snippet: The Australian packaging group Amcor is nearing a purchase of some of Rio Tinto’s assets, in a deal that could be valued at up to $2.4 billion, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: The Australian packaging group Amcor is nearing a purchase of some of Rio Tinto‘s assets, in a deal that could be valued at up to $2.4 billion, Reuters reported, citing unnamed sources.

headline.main: Amcor Said to Be  Near Deal for Some Rio Tinto Assets

abstract: Australia’s foreign minister said an Australian employee of the mining company Rio Tinto had been detained in China on suspicion of espionage and stealing state secrets.
snippet: Australia’s foreign minister said an Australian employee of the mining company Rio Tinto had been detained in China on suspicion of espionage and stealing state secrets.
lead_paragraph: Australia’s foreign minister said Wednesday that an Australian employee of mining company Rio Tinto has been detained in China on suspicion of espionage and stealing state secrets.

headline.main: Australian Mining Staffer Held in China on Spying Charge
